article_title: Texas hospitals make bid to expand health insurance
article_text: To continue reading this story, you will need to be a digital subscriber to HoustonChronicle.com.

og.description: The Texas Hospiatal Association has launched a campaign to provide health insurance for the 6 million people who don't currently have it. The coalition is suggesting a "Texas Way" that would likely expand coverage for the poor by using federal Medicaid dollars to subsidize private insurance policies. The goal is to reduce the $5.5 billion in uncompensated care that hospitals provide every year.
og.title: Texas hospitals make bid to expand health insurance
